intro: Mesosphaerum rubiginosum, commonly known as the rusty mesosphaerum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically in shades of pink to reddish-brown, which contribute to its common name. Mesosphaerum rubiginosum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
